description.value:
You release a pulsating, vibrant beam of chaotic energy at one creature in range. The target must succeed a Charisma saving throw, or on a failure be subject to the Chaotic Implications table. Roll [[/r 3d8]], and choose one of the d8s. If you roll doubles then that option is not available to you for this spell casting. If you roll triples then you can pick your desired effects from the table, and the spell slot is not expended for this casting.

[[/r d8]]Chaotic Implications
1The targets grasp on reality is shaken; they are &Reference[Blinded] and &Reference[Deafened] to their surroundings while they navigate utterly lost in a wobbling world only they can perceive until the spell ends. Whenever the target takes damage, it can make a Charisma saving throw to attempt to end this spell.
2The target is &Reference[Dazed], and any attempt it makes to teleport or to leave its current plane by any means fails until the spell ends.
3You become &Reference[Invisible] to the target until the spell ends.
4You become &Reference[Petrified], however instead of becoming incapacitated, you possess your target until the spell ends. When the spell ends, you are no longer petrified at the end of your next turn.
5The target is &Reference[Weakened] until the spell ends.
6The creature's size category is reduced by up to two; down to a minimum size of Tiny. The target deals only half damage with weapon attacks and unarmed strikes until the spell ends.
7The creature is magically fixed in place and must make a [[/check Strength]] check against your spell save DC as an action to move. On a success, the creature can move up to 10 feet.
8The target loses any conditional and damage immunities but has resistance to those damage types until the end of its next turn. Then the spell ends.

Whatever the effect from the Chaotic Implications table, it lasts up to 1 minute, unless stated otherwise. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.
